TourInformationItem.TourName: Winter Wonders: Yellowstone and Grand Teton National Parks winter adventure"

TextItem.Title: Short Description
TextItem.Description:
With your naturalist guides, you'll follow boardwalks through steamy, ethereal geyser basins; snowshoe across sparkling, snowy expanses; enjoy an elk-watching sleigh ride; and explore the two parks in search of bison, elk, wolves, coyotes, otters, bighorn sheep, eagles, and other winter-adapted creatures. Choose from active or laid-back activity options from snowshoeing and cross-country skiing to sitting by the fire. There's something for everyone on this fun trip.

  • Wildlife watching: Winter is a fabulous time to see wildlife, as animals gather in the valleys. There are amazing opportunities to see elk, bison, otters, coyotes, and possibly the elusive wolves.
  • Thermal features: Drifting steam and fog make winter in the geyser basins otherworldly.
  • Happy Holidays: Celebrate Christmas, Chanukah, winter solstice, or the December holiday of your choice at the Old Faithful Snow Lodge.
  • Snow sports: Enjoy snowshoeing to backcountry geysers, cross-country skiing, and a sleigh ride.

TextItem.Title: Itinerary
TextItem.Description:
Day 1 (Yellowstone National Park) Board a special over-the-snow vehicle and take the scenic route to the Old Faithful Snow Lodge, maybe sharing sections of the road with wandering bison. Along the way, watch for great herds of elk, playful otters, and other wildlife, and stop to peer into the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone to see the towering, iced-over falls.

Day 2 (Yellowstone National Park) Walk the steamy, snowy, magical boardwalk trails through the Upper Geyser Basin, which holds the largest concentration of geysers in the world. See Old Faithful, Grand Geyser, Morning Glory Pool, and other amazing features. After lunch, rent snowshoes or cross-country skis to continue your explorations through the surrounding forested trails.

Day 3 (Yellowstone National Park) A snow coach will shuttle you and your guide to a trailhead where you can cross-country ski or snowshoe along lovely backcountry trails to off-the-beaten-path geysers and other sights that only the lucky, plucky few get to see.

Day 4 (Jackson and Grand Teton National Park) Board the snow coaches and head south to Grand Teton National Park, for breathtaking views of these jagged peaks. We'll take our time driving through the park, stopping at scenic overlooks for photo opportunities and wildlife watching. This evening, enjoy the shops and galleries of the Jackson town square.

Day 5 (Jackson and Grand Teton National Park) A horse-drawn sleigh takes us out into the elk refuge, where we watch for bull elk and listen as the herd hums and calls to each other. Later we take a private tour of the remarkable National Museum of Wildlife Art, then head back into the park for more exploring.

Day 6 (Departures home) Catch a flight home at your convenience from the Jackson Airport, or plan your departure from the larger Idaho Falls airport.
